issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hi All,

Trying to attach an EBS to running Linux instance on Eucalyptus cloud running 3.3.1 with following RPM 

{code}
euca2ools-2.1.3-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-enterprise-vmware-broker-libs-3.3.1-0.0.1317.20130820gite976e080.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-3.3.1-0.0.1359.20130820git4af9cfdc.el6.x86_64
python-eucadmin-3.3.1-0.0.1359.20130820git4af9cfdc.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-gl-3.3.1-0.0.1359.20130820git4af9cfdc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cc-3.3.1-0.0.1359.20130820git4af9cfdc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-3.3.1-0.0.1359.20130820git4af9cfdc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-vmware-broker-3.3.1-0.0.1317.20130820gite976e080.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.3.1-0.0.1359.20130820git4af9cfdc.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.3.1-0.0.1359.20130820git4af9cfdc.el6.x86_64
{code}

Following error is seen:

java.rmi.RemoteException: Volume export request to storage controller failed.; nested exception is:

Found: []

	at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.vsphere.VSphereEndpointAsync$19.call(VSphereEndpointAsync.java:632)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:334)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:166)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:724)
Caused by: com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Unable to encrypt data with node private key: Failed to find a cluster with the corresponding partition name for this SC: unregistered
Found: []
	at com.eucalyptus.util.BlockStorageUtil.decryptForNode(BlockStorageUtil.java:166)
	at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.VMwareEBSVolume.reencryptForTransfer(VMwareEBSVolume.java:164)
	at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.VMwareEBSVolume.requestVolumeExport(VMwareEBSVolume.java:122)
	at com.eucalyptus.cloud.ws.vsphere.VSphereEndpoint.doAttachVolume(VSphereEndpoint.java:739)
	... 8 more
Caused by: com.eucalyptus.util.EucalyptusCloudException: Failed to find a cluster with the corresponding partition name for this SC: unregistered
Found: []
	at com.eucalyptus.util.BlockStorageUtil.decryptForNode(BlockStorageUtil.java:156)
	... 11 more
{code}

This is available inside PRC , if you want more details let me know. I will uploading the logs with EXTREME level shortly.

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: cannot attach ebs to instance with remote SC and vmware broker

comments.body:
euca-describe-services 

{code}
SERVICE	vmwarebroker   	cloud331       	broker01       	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.211:8773/services/VMwareBroker	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloud331:vmwarebroker:broker01/
SERVICE	tokens         	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Tokens	arn:euca:eucalyptus::tokens:10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	storage        	cloud331       	sc01           	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.212:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloud331:storage:sc01/
SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Jetty 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	walrus         	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus/
SERVICE	euare          	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Euare 	arn:euca:eucalyptus::euare:10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	loadbalancing  	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	NOTREADY  	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/LoadBalancing	arn:euca:eucalyptus::loadbalancing:10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	cloudwatch     	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/CloudWatch	arn:euca:eucalyptus::cloudwatch:10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	cluster        	cloud331       	cc01           	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.211:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cloud331:cluster:cc01/
SERVICE	reporting      	bootstrap      	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Reporting	arn:euca:bootstrap::reporting:10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	autoscaling    	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/AutoScaling	arn:euca:eucalyptus::autoscaling:10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Dns   	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:10.104.1.210/
SERVICE	notifications  	eucalyptus     	10.104.1.210   	ENABLED   	43  	http://10.104.1.210:8773/services/Notifications	arn:euca:eucalyptus::notifications:10.104.1.210/
{code}
important data point, it was working without any issue in 3.2.2 , the same topology but not in 3.3.0 and also not in 3.3.1

So far I have tried:

1) MD5 all keys, ensure they are synced properly
2) Deregister/reregister SC/VB/CC 

To no avail.

Found the issue: BlockStorageUtil.java:154

The issue is some code was re-used for encrypt/decrypt of tokens in the broker and a couple of layers deep that code also assumes it is running on the SC and accesses a variable that is only initialized during SC bootstrap. In the case where the SC and Broker are not co-located it remains null and causes a key lookup to fail. The Broker uses BlockStorageUtil for encrypt/decrypt of the volume token prior to sending it on the wire.

The fix is to make all of the BlockStorageUtil code component agnostic so that it can run anywhere.
[~zhill], [~viglesias], [~neil], [~kedwards], this is a high priority last minute fix for 3.3.1.  Let's get it into 3.3.1 today.

Have fix, waiting for test setup to finish and will begin testing the fix.

Test config:
CLC/WS
SC
CC/Broker
NC
NC

See internal commit: a7978f11985c392be1d18f15ed0f607ba19d7bb2

Tests run: verified reproducibility with euca-sequence-3.3-dns as well as manual testing on the pre-fix maint/3.3/testing code and a deployment topology of CLC/WS, CC/Broker, SC, NC, NC. Updated to patched code and passed manual testing for ebs volume attach/detach (with in-instance confirmation) as well as running and passing ebs-suite and stop-start-ebs smoke tests.

Additional testing needed: non-VMware configurations and multi-cluster deployments. The regression risk is similar to the original bug: failed attachment due to missing keys.

Thanks [~zhill] , I took this one for spin with following packages

{code}
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.3.1-0.0.1403.20130822git97552e94.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-3.3.1-0.0.1403.20130822git97552e94.el6.x86_64
euca2ools-release-3.0-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-3.3.1-0.0.1403.20130822git97552e94.el6.x86_64
python-eucadmin-3.3.1-0.0.1403.20130822git97552e94.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-3.3.1-0.0.1403.20130822git97552e94.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-vmware-broker-libs-3.3.1-0.0.1361.20130822gitf80fa035.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.3.1-0.0.1403.20130822git97552e94.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-walrus-3.3.1-0.0.1403.20130822git97552e94.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-vmware-broker-3.3.1-0.0.1361.20130822gitf80fa035.el6.x86_64
{code}

I did manual testing on my multi-{cluster,hypervisor} cloud based on above packages. 

I could do these (used precise server EMI)

a) Create a EBS volume and attach it to an instance running on ESXi 
b) Create a EBS volume and attach it to an instance running on KVM
c) Run a EBS instance on KVM and ESXi , confirm it boots.
d) Stop and Start EBS instance on KVM and ESXi , confirm it works
e) Attach an external data volume to EBS instance on KVM and ESXi , confirm it works
f) Stop and Start EBS instance with external data volume attached on KVM and ESXi, confirm it works
g) Create snapshot of EBS on KVM and VMware clusters, confirm it works

I didn't get a chance to test the various blockdevicemapping functionality but if it could be affected I am happy to do manual tests for them in my cloud.

Thanks again for quick turnaround on this , greatly appreciated. Please let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers!
Deependra

[~dshekhawat], no need to do additional block-device-mapping tests, it is all the same code, so if a regular attachment works then so will the block device mappings. Thanks for getting this tested so quickly.

Verified the multi-cluster ebs_suite test unit and ebs-extended sequence with the the SC remote from other components. See topo below. 
Thanks,
-M

10.111.1.1	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC WS UI]
10.111.1.2	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
10.111.1.14	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]
10.111.1.46	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC01]
10.111.1.54	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[SC01]
10.111.1.99	VMWARE	ESXI-5.0	64	REPO	[NC01]
10.111.5.18	VMWARE	ESXI-5.0	64	REPO	[NC01]
